data.text: @RealNateHorsman @SDECoxHealth I don’t think it’s an issue of people gathering in groups anymore. I think it’s a result of the virus being much weaker, thank God.

@SDECoxHealth Spent time in Cox ER last night for what was determined to be a benign issue. So impressed with your staffs care and professionalism from checkin to release. Dr. Porter, attending nurse Brooklyn, and Sarah in radiology are all first class and outstanding care providers.

@RealNateHorsman It’s been over 700 days you have been exposed live your life, trust your vaccine if you got it. Stop worrying. The cure can’t be worse than the disease and it sounds like your anxiety over it is putting you there.

@SDECoxHealth With Spring Break coming to Branson I am really hoping we can hold the line and case numbers stay manageable. This will be a litmus test for the Summer season to come. I’m going back in the trenches next week and I would be lying if I didn’t say I have some anxiety about it.
@SDECoxHealth Great news! I miss my job, but in a good way…

@PeriRedfearn Paul Starr once wrote, “The dream of reason did not take power into account.” The US has had the highest death rate of western countries. We failed due to the hubris of those striving for political power.” The Internet amplified necrotizing voices.

@SDECoxHealth Gonna miss you Steve.  I have come to believe that if the internet had existed all those years ago we would not have the life saving vaccines that we have now.  Polio, smallpox, etc.  Your thoughts?
@SDECoxHealth This is the best news in a long time!
@SDECoxHealth @wrap02 At least until the new variant gets here.
